attributes.action: Make MPs resign if they oppose the will of the majority of their constituents.
attributes.background: The British people vote for their preferred members of parliament every five years. During the five year period of government the average British citizen has little influence over decisions and actions of the government of the day.
attributes.additional_details:
This is not so with those of us who are rich and powerful. These people have the means to influence government decisions through lobbying and legal challenge, both not readily available to the general public.
These methods of changing government actions are a challenge to the democratic processes of a nation and introduce inequality into a democratic society. To meet that challenge and rebalance democracy  this petition asks parliament to introduce a bill that holds members of parliament to immediately resign from office if they are found to be opposing the will of the majority of the constituents they represent."

attributes.action: Hold a public vote on the options for the future UK/EU (and global) trade model
attributes.background: In June the UK electorate voted to leave the EU by a narrow majority. It has since become clear that there was no clear plan defined and little information given about the options. A public decision can only be valid if a clear intent of the direction the government wishes to take us is proposed.
attributes.additional_details:
The outcome of the advisory referendum on 23rd June means that the government must now propose defined exit plans for terms of leaving the EU.

However, leaving the EU is too momentous a decision to proceed without a clear understanding of the proposed model.

We call for a public vote to be held before Article 50 is invoked, on the options for the future UK/EU (and global) trade model with impartial assessments of the consequences of each option, including the option of staying in the EU.

attributes.action: Call a general election immediately after Conservative party leadership decided
attributes.background: Labour & Conservatives contested the 2015 General Election with policies based on continuing EU membership.David Cameron has now resigned.The political landscape is now changed.Parties must devise new manifestos based on EU exit & transition & put to the electorate to decide who leads us through it.

attributes.action: Monitoring in pregnancy for every woman who has received cervical treatments
attributes.background:
Myself & my fiancé lost our beautiful baby boy, Oscar, after he was born prematurely at 24 weeks. 
My waters broke due to an incompetent cervix that was never checked or monitored despite having part of my cervix removed after a Lletz procedure.
attributes.additional_details:
The amount of cells that were removed from my cervix were classified as low risk and therefore no further monitoring or checks were made during pregnancy. Had I been monitored my incompetent cervix would have been diagnosed and our perfect son may be here today. 
I am petitioning for every pregnant woman who has undergone any type of treatment compromising their cervix to be monitored during their pregnancy to prevent baby losses like ours occurring in the future.

attributes.action: The UK must ratify the Paris Agreement on climate change immediately
attributes.background: At COP21 in December of 2015 real progress was made in creating global agreement for a low carbon future. For these agreements to be legally binding 55 countries representing 55% of global emissions must ratify the Paris Agreement. The US and China have just ratified- the UK must follow suit.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK represents 1,55% of global emissions, so its signature would make a tangible difference
http://unfccc.int/paris_agreement/items/9444.php

http://climateanalytics.org/hot-topics/ratification-tracker.html

We stand a real chance for progress now China and the US have signed (the worlds two biggest emitters by far).
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-china-37265541

attributes.action: Stop Yorkshire Ambulance Services plan to downgrade Honely Ambulance Station.
attributes.background: YAS intend to reduce the cover at Honley Ambulance Station. We believe this will have serious implications for the public.The plans will leave the area devoid of cover for long periods of time.We are asking for your support to protect the service that we provide for the local communities.
attributes.additional_details: Staffing levels are to be reduced by 40% which will result in a 50% decrease in ambulance and rapid response vehicle cover. The area covered by this station includes the Holme, Colne, Dearne Valleys and the Huddersfield area.  The planned reduction to 1 ambulance crew 24/7 will mean this area will be without emergency cover for long periods of time. Statistics show that a high % of life threatening time critical emergency calls are already not achieved due to a lack of available resources.

attributes.action: DWP and its contractors to have mandatory training in understanding Autism.
attributes.background: Since the Conservative Govt have been in power and the treasury have stated that major changes will happen for AUSTERITY. Myself and many families looking after Autistic children/adults have been made to feel that AUTISM is not a disability. Many families are struggling with the loss of benefits.
attributes.additional_details: As a mother of 2 Autistic children I have joined many groups online.  Reading stories of family's being told they can no longer have benefits with a diagnosis of Autism. We need change to make DWP and its contractors aware that Autism is a lifelong, developmental disability that affects how a person communicates with and relates to other people, and how they experience the world around them, Without these benefits they cannot have carers or support please STOP AUSTERITY WITH AUTISM

attributes.action: Make congenital heart defect a registered disability
attributes.background: Many babies each year are born with heart defects, these babies face many tests, procedures and surgeries throughout there lives. As an adult with a congenital heart defect I'm facing increasing problems but there's a lack of support as heart conditions aren't a recognised disability.

attributes.action: Stop Sodexo from closing Katie's Kitchen
attributes.background: Katie's kitchen is a food van that his been running for over 20 years and now is being shut down by the greed of Sodexo. Katie's kitchen has given joy to surviving soldiers for many many years by coming out on exercise and saving the troops from the rotting stomach of ration packs
attributes.additional_details: Sodexo food is over priced and under quality. They will double the price of Katie's kitchen and they don't want any competition

attributes.action: 1.An MP's home residence address needs to be located in their own constituency?
attributes.background: The electorate only vote in the constituency where they live this rule is not a requirement to become an MP meaning if you wished to be an MP you could stand for any constituency in the UK the rules that apply to the constituencies voters should apply to anyone who stand as the MP.

attributes.action: Ensure all apprentices are paid the National Minimum Wage for their age.
attributes.background: The current rate is £3.40 per hour as of October 2016, (rising to £3.50 as of April 2017)  for apprentices aged 16 to 18 and those aged 19 or over who are in their first year. All other apprentices are entitled to the National Minimum Wage for their age)
attributes.additional_details:
Apprentices who earn just £3.40 an hour are struggling to make ends meet.  This wage is not financially viable.  In addition, an apprentice can spend a high proportion of their wage travelling to work.  
Apprentices should be paid National Minimum Wage from the start. 
Apprenticeships can be an important way for young people to get into employment and earn while they learn. But young workers should not be used as cheap labour.  All young people deserve to be paid a decent minimum wage.

attributes.action: Give all ancient woodland statutory legal protection
attributes.background: Ancient woodland is recognised as irreplaceable due to the specialised plant and animal species they support, not found elsewhere. As a result of habitat loss and fragmentation over the last 50 years 60% of those specialised species have declined significantly according to the State of Nature Report
attributes.additional_details: Ancient woodlands are a vital part of our cultural heritage, often containing archaeological remains waiting to be discovered, yet 85% of it has no legal protection. If we are to commit to our climate, flood alleviation and biodiversity action plan obligations these habitats must be protected from vandalism and development. At one time woodland covered the majority of the UK, as relics of this wild wood we must ensure that our ancient woodlands survive for the benefit of future generations.

attributes.action: I do not believe we really need or want to have drones delivering parcels
attributes.background: Amazon and the government are about to conduct trials using drones to deliver parcels to their customers. Where Amazon go others will follow. Should we sacrifice the peace and quiet of the air for the benefit of a few and the profit of big corporations. Lets leave the sky above for the birds.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/video_and_audio/headlines/36887326
The talk is all about safety and not whether the public want or need such a service.

attributes.action: Ban the use of inhumane rodent glue traps in the UK
attributes.background:
Rodent glue traps are mats covered in a very sticky adhesive from which it's victims cannot escape. It can take hours, even days from being caught to being killed, in which time they will usually die from exhaustion in the attempt to escape.
Let's get these disgusting things banned. Thank you.
attributes.additional_details: Ireland and New Zealand have banned glue traps and many major stores around the world have stopped selling them.

attributes.action: UK GOVERNMENT TO ACTIVELY PURSUE URGENT PEACE NEGOTIATIONS IN SYRIA
attributes.background: How long will this unrelentless suffering, mass destruction  and massacre of innocent lives continue to be silenced, ignored and accepted by the international community ?
attributes.additional_details:
After six years the Syrian civil war is increasing with rage  with no end in sight. 
Since the  war began, as many as 386,000 people have been killed, including nearly 14,000 children.  The war has become more deadly since foreign powers have joined the conflict.  The only way to end this catastrophe is for the world to stand together and remove Assad and his regime. 

Eastern Aleppo has become the key strategic battleground and an epitome of this brutal, barbaric and morally shameless and tragic war in Syria.  It has been besieged, bombed, starved and strangled as part of the Assad’s regime ‘Starve or Kneel’ strategy. 

Let's show the innocent children of Syria and its people that their lives do matter, that we do care and the world has not forgotten!

attributes.action: Ban the use of pike gags and lip grips in England.
attributes.background:
Pike gags are a spring device that is used to hold a fishes mouth open to allow for unhooking. They are ban in Scotland as they are a barbaric tool.

Lip grips are a mechanical device that hold fish by the bottom jaw bone with a clamp
attributes.additional_details: Both pike gags and lip grips cause permenant damage to the jaw bone of pike and other boney mouth species

attributes.action: Bring back the death sentence for child murderers and peadophiles
attributes.background: We all want a better future for a children , a safer future . Punishments for predatory child killers and child abusers are nowhere near harsh enough . We as a people should give these predators through a democratic process something to fear to help keep our children and their future children safe .

attributes.action: Prevent Ministers and MP's to talk until debate runs out of time.
attributes.background: The Government to impose a time restriction on Ministers and MP's to talk in Private Members Bills debates in line with the time given to debate. The current system gives members the opportunity to talk until time runs out, shelving the debate. This is not democratic and discredits the system.
attributes.additional_details: The current system allows for Ministers and Members of Parliament to be able to talk out Private Members Bills when they know they are running out of time. Placing time restrictions on Members of Parliament and Ministers in attendance of the debate in relation to the time that can be given to a debate (minimum or maximum) to stop shelving Bills. Bills should be voted on in Parliament whether they progress to the next stage or refused without a third option, to talk out a debate.

attributes.action: Stop HS2 destroying our villages in Barnburgh and Harlington. No to HS2
attributes.background: HS2 wants to run a high speed train through Mexborough, destroying homes, & Barnburgh and Harlington, destroying countryside. If it gets the go-ahead 18 trains per hour - running 5am until midnight - will pass through our town/villages. Sign this petition to say NO to HS2 destroying our area.

attributes.action: Government to immediately legislate that  visitors to UK  have Health Insurance
attributes.background: The NHS is a great institution, and unfortunately is now in dire straits. Health tourists  are taking advantage of a system that is not fit for purpose.  On arrival into the country  medical insurance must be provided with immediate effect.

attributes.action: Reduce the rate of Value Added Tax in the UK from the current 20% to 15%.
attributes.background: The cost of living for the majority of UK citizens is punitive. The lowest band of income tax rate at 20% is unaffordable for many. The tax free bands are too low. Families are homeless and hungry. If companies are to get tax breaks, citizens should too. Reduction in VAT will stimulate the economy.

attributes.action: Sizeably increase and improve upon current funding for domestic abuse refuges.
attributes.background: Between early 2015 and '16, 30 refuges were forced to close as a result of inadequate funding. There are currently 272 refuges across the UK, sharing between them just £20 million of annual government funding. This lack of funding is, in part, responsible for 2 domestic female homicides every week.
attributes.additional_details: Domestic abuse refuges save lives. But they are in dire straits; scarce government funding serves merely to 'patch up' issues which reemerge in exacerbated form each year. Refuges have excessively suffered from recent spending cuts, with 44% of services in 2015 operating without any reliable funding over the previous year. On just one day in 2015, 167 women and children were turned away from 129 refuges nationwide, with 23.27% of referrals in said year being declined out of financial necessity.

attributes.action: Create a Ministerial position for the Self Employed
attributes.background:
There are almost 4.8 million self employed people in the UK who have no direct representation in Government.  Whilst there is a Minister for Small Business (which is applauded), the needs of the self employed, in many cases, are very different to even small employers.
This needs to be addressed
attributes.additional_details:
Areas that need addressing include (but are not limited to):

- The need for a 'self employed bank account' - A simple transactional account
- Affordable financial services - Realistically priced income protection and medical cover should be introduced.
- The levelling of the playing field in terms of maternity and paternity
- Increased Pension provision - employees are being encouraged to enrolled into a Workplace Pension.  What is the sole trader equivalent?   

What else can you add?

attributes.action: Increase the number of Police Constables and Increase Police Constables Pay
attributes.background: The number of Police officers continue to drop every year down to 207,140 as of March 31st 2015. More and more harsh cuts effect the safety of everyone, leave Police forces stretched and workload too high for each officer. Pay for officers is also too low and only getting 1% is a slap in the face.
attributes.additional_details: Government reports show the downward spiral in numbers. An offer of just 1% pay rise is just not acceptable, for the hard work, long hours and low pay that our officers have to put in. Especially in a modern environment filled with danger, our officers put their lives on the line, every day that they report for duty. They are not permitted to industrial strike action and have little in the way of representation. The people of the U.K. Now need to show our officers that we support them.

attributes.action: A second referendum to consider the issue of Brexit before Article 50 is invoked
attributes.background: The UK Referendum of 24 June 2016 has profound social, economic and political implications. The results reveal the margin is less than 2% and more than 16 million people of voting age want to remain. The 18-50 age group is overwhelmingly remain.
attributes.additional_details:
Polling information shows the age group 18-50 (those that have to live with this result the longest) is overwhelmingly pro-remain (68%). Their democratic will should not be ignored.

More than 1 million Brits were excluded from the vote for having lived outside the UK for more than 15 years. Had they been eligible to vote, this is very likely to have returned a different result. 

It is appropriate in these circumstances for the UK Parliament to consider convening a second, more open referendum.

attributes.action: Give right to remain for commonwealth citizens who serve in the UK Armed Forces
attributes.background: There are cases of Commonwealth citizens who've served in the UK Armed Forces and once out, do not have the automatic right to remain. One case involves a Jamaican who served in the Royal Navy but his application has taken over a year, meanwhile he cannot work or claim benefits. This must change!

attributes.action: Review the work of the Lowcost Holidays travel company bankruptcy scandal
attributes.background: Lowcost Holidays has gone into administration owing thousands of pounds to over 110,000 UK customers also without a holiday many of which were booked months in advance. Lowcost Holidays used to be ATOL and ABTA protected but moved to Majorca at the end of 2013.
attributes.additional_details: The practice of travel companies not paying for hotel accommodation/flights/transfers after they've been paid by customers should be made illegal. It's a company based within the EU but there is little or no EU protection for its citizens against this poor practice or when a travel company goes into administration. Why?

attributes.action: Change the prejudiced welfare system - Keep families together!
attributes.background: The welfare system does not grant enough rights to families to care for grandchildren. It is too prejudiced.  They are far too eager to take babies away for adoption. We need reform in the current system please.
attributes.additional_details: I can provide references which a personal to me but also which I am absolutely positive that other families out there will be in the same position to provide.

attributes.action: Cyclists to display identification such as a number plate for accountability
attributes.background:
I believe because cyclists have anonymity some  ignore the Highway Code, creating a danger to themselves, other road users and pedestrians
I have witnessed numerous dangerous, reckless and ignorant actions
Identification and accountability could make the roads a safer place.
attributes.additional_details:
To reduce the risk cyclists present to themselves and others. Through accountability  to create a culture of best practice.
In an age of speed cameras and dashboard cams to make the cyclist identifiable when involved or causing incidents.
To promote greater harmony between the motorist and cyclist. To make the roads a safer place for pedestrians.

attributes.action: Include Halal and Kosher slaughter in the Animal Welfare Act 2006
attributes.background: In times of equality and social integration, it is wrong to exempt the slaughter practises of Halal and Kosher from the Animal Welare Act.
attributes.additional_details: The exemption is currently published in the Animal Welfare Act 2006

attributes.action: To get the NHS to give cancer patients full body screening yearly
attributes.background: I would like the NHS change the way the NHS screen for cancer. I have lost Family members to cancer including my Dad. I myself am living with cancer and it scares me to death for myself and my 7 year old daughter who needs me here to be her mum. I want full screening every year for cancer patients.
attributes.additional_details: In my experience cancer does come back  and quite often in a different area. This is why I feel it is important for all past and present cancer patients to receive a full body screening every year. I had a ovarian tumour removed in 2012 now in 2016 I have bowel cancer, I did receive yearly bloods targeted in pelvic area and the bowel cancer wasn't found. I feel by having full body screening yearly could save more lives, and less invasive treatment.

attributes.action: Update Psychiatric Diagnosis Procedures so they are accountable & evidence-based
attributes.background: Psychiatry is under criticism for its subjectivity and unaccountability.Brief crises are defined as lifelong conditions.There is no recognition of this ambiguity.Complaints are seen as symptoms.Patients are misunderstood or slandered.The pessimism of working in a Hospital causes Confirmation Bias.

attributes.action: Ban the practice of 'crossing the floor' by an elected member of parliament.
attributes.background: The practice of 'crossing the floor' in Parliament is dishonest and is a betrayal of the constituents who voted for a particular MP. If an MP wishes to either join a different party or form a new one he should announce his intention and immediately resign his seat in order to stand in a by-election.

attributes.action: Improve Rural Broadband by making ISP's more accountable for poor Download Speed
attributes.background: Rural Broadband speeds in Rural areas (especially in East Anglia) are unacceptable.  There is no incentive for Internet Service Providers to improve performance - (they get paid the full monthly fee whatever the download speed) - they are not accountable and need government intervention to improve.
attributes.additional_details: In many rural areas (I live in Aldeby, Norfolk), rural business, farms, pubs, shops and private homes endure download speeds of less than >1mbps.  In this day and age in our digital world this is disadvantaging rural business and communities.  Our children are set school homework on-line and cannot access broadband to research it.  Our businesses cannot operate efficiently and trade effectively, farming business need to operate on-line to embrace new technology - we demand swift action from MP's

attributes.action: Amend the recall of parliament act 2015 to allow the electorate to dismiss MPs
attributes.background:
Amend the recall of parliament act 2015 to allow for fresh elections when 40% of the last turnout at a constituency election signs a petition calling for that.

The British public demand the means to remove our MPs if they are not acting in the interest of the British people
attributes.additional_details:
For far too long, prospective members of parliament and political parties of all denominations, have lied to the British public in order to get elected. 

The only way to ensure that those elected to office, keep their word once chosen to speak for the people, is to give the public the right to sack their MPs or government in much the same way that you would sack a negligent or under performing employee.

Many MP's are openly disregarding the will of the people and should therefore be removed.

attributes.action: Save our Fishermen: Lobby for our fishermen to be allowed to gill net for bass.
attributes.background: We are calling on George Eustice, the UK Fisheries Minister, to reject the Commission's proposals and not to cave in to angling lobbyist.  A lot of our struggling small boat commercial fishermen (under 10’s) depend on netting sea bass to keep their businesses afloat.

attributes.action: Amend Shortage Occupation rules that are blocking the hiring of Specialist Chefs
attributes.background: UK's Asian cuisine industry is lacking skill ready Professional Chefs. Though Chefs are on government's Shortage Occupation list it disqualifies restaurants that allow collection or delivery of restaurant meals as NOT having specialist skill needs in spite of this involving the same skill input
attributes.additional_details:
The industry is in urgent need of experienced skill ready Chefs from outside EU on temporary basis to support business operations, and to enable training and development of home grown Chefs. However this is being prevented by inappropriate rules. This petition calls for following amendments to the Shortage Occupation rules 

1. Remove the 'take away' clause

2. Raise skill recognition to NQF level 6  

3. Amend minimum salary to £25,000 

4. Allow temporary non settlement based UK entry

attributes.action: Upgrade the A34 to modern 3 lane motorway standards.
attributes.background: The A34 is a very busy dual carriageway carrying ever increasing levels of traffic between the Midlands and down to the South Coast. The road was built for a bygone era and is no longer fit for purpose. There have now been numerous fatalities and serious accidents on this road in recent times.
attributes.additional_details: With the exception of the Newbury Bypass and the improved junction with the M4, the rest of the road from the M40 all the way down to Winchester was constructed in the 1970s. Bends, gradients, junctions and sight lines are not up to modern standards. The solution would be to widen and totally reconstruct the road, realigning it where necessary. If needed, funds could be found by not spending £900+ million earmarked for making the M4 around Reading a "smart motorway". The A34 is much more urgent.

attributes.action: Debate if "Safe Standing" could be introduced to all seater stadia in England
attributes.background:
The most impactful recommendation of the Taylor report in 1989 was the requirement that all football stadia in the top two divisions of English football had to be all seater. 

Large numbers of fans still stand at football matches and would like to continue to do this in a safe and legal manner.
attributes.additional_details:
Taylor report - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taylor_Report

Safe standing article (admittedly with a rail seat firm) - http://www.joe.co.uk/sport/safe-standing-qa/91188

Safe Standing facts from the Football Supporters Federation - http://www.fsf.org.uk/campaigns/safe-standing/safe-standing-facts/

attributes.action: No new trade deals with China until they stop forced organ harvesting
attributes.background: Doctors Against Forced Organ Harvesting (DAFOH) have estimated between 100,000 and 200,000 Falun Gong practitioners have been subjected to forced organ harvesting since 2000.
attributes.additional_details: Constant persecution, torture and imprisonment of religious followers is contrary to the values of the right to human life that we hold dear in the United Kingdom. We implore you to insist that any trade deals between the CCP and the UK are conditional on an end to forced organ harvesting and any form of oppression towards religious followers.

attributes.action: Make lumacaftor and ivacaftor available on the NHS for cystic fibrosis patients
attributes.background: I have a daughter with cystic fibrosis who has this awful disease for the rest of her life, doctors have found a new drug that helps the mucus thin and more easy to pass, mucus being the main factor of the disease,  but the government will not make this drug available as it is too expensive
attributes.additional_details: But they will make methadone available for the use of heroin addicts. Heroin addicts who choose to take this drug, methadone costs the NHS 1billion a year, these drugs that will help cystic fibrosis patients dramatically cost a mere 80million more than methadone. Thanks

attributes.action: Create an Independent Body to regulate Speedway Clubs and Teams
attributes.background: Currently Speedway is run by the British Speedway Promotors Association, however we feel that this body of people are not running the Speedway sport in the interest of the riders or the fans, this is because the body of people are formed by the speedway promotors who own the clubs.
attributes.additional_details:
Because the sport is run by people who own the clubs, decisions and rules are made individually to suit their needs, and what will make them make more money or save them loosing money. 

The pay and working conditions for riders are very poor, this is not what fans pay to see.

attributes.action: A Call to Action:  Raising Awareness of Mental Ill-health in Higher Education
attributes.background:
The government and higher education authorities must recognise and prioritise the 'student voice' in promoting mental ill-health in higher education. Josephine NwaAmaka Bardi

Please copy and paste the link below to read more.  

https://imhblog.wordpress.com/
attributes.additional_details:
There is no health without mental health (Department of Health, 2011) just as there may be no academic achievement without mental health.

Please sign the petition in support of this extremely important issue.

It is hoped that our collective signatures will prompt the government to recognise and debate the importance of actively promoting the awareness of mental ill-health in higher education.

Josephine NwaAmaka Bardi
Mental Health Nurse
PhD Student

attributes.action: Approve TfL's October 2016 plan to transfer management of suburban rail to TfL.
attributes.background: Users of London's suburban rail services deserve a better service. They deserve more reliable, faster, more frequent trains with increased capacity, as proposed by TfL: https://tfl.gov.uk/corporate/about-tfl/how-we-work/planning-for-the-future/developing-the-rail-network#on-this-page-1
attributes.additional_details: It's been reported today (23/11/2016) that DfT wants joint working between TfL and the rail companies, not takeovers. The rail companies have had years to improve their services, but have failed to do so. The time for second chances has long passed and rail users need to see change and improvements urgently.

attributes.action: The UK must not leave the European Economic Area (EEA) without a referendum
attributes.background: The UK voted in a referendum on 23rd June 2016 to leave the European Union. No referendum has been held on whether the UK should leave the European Economic Area (EEA). Therefore we, the undersigned, ask HM Government to legislate that the United Kingdom cannot leave the EEA without a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: The European Economic Area (EEA) comprises all 28 EU member states plus Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein. Membership of the EU and EEA is separate, as evidenced by Croatia's joining of the EU on 1st July 2013 and its delayed provisional joining of the EEA on 12th April 2014. Most rights enjoyed by citizens of EU countries apply equally to citizens of EEA countries, most notably the free movement of people. If the UK leaves the EU without leaving the EEA, it will be similar to Norway or Iceland.

attributes.action: Make .22 Rimfire Pistols legal for Sporting purposes on FAC Certificates
attributes.background: In 1997 The UK Labour party Prime minister Tony Blair brought in The Firearm Ammendment Act of 1997 Number 2 which banned all .22 rimfire pistols for section 1 holders. I feel like the ban was unessecary and pointless and I feel that we have been treated as gulity people but we are not.
attributes.additional_details: Whoever holds a section 1 licence should have any gun they wish. Because what doesn't make sense is that if 22 rimfire semi auto rifles are legal then why can't we own a 22 rimfire pistol. If we somehow stand up against anti gun people and prove to them of how guns are not evil people that are bad are evil. If you even don't have a licence but support this sport you can push us to victory and freedom for this sport and live in a country with zero threat.

attributes.action: Make co-operation with Trump administration conditional on human rights.
attributes.background:
Angela Merkel promised co-operation on the condition that “values of democracy, freedom and respect for the law and the dignity of man, independent of origin, skin colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation or political views” were upheld.
The UK Government should publicly adopt the same stance.

attributes.action: The taxpayer should pay for the defence of our servicemen and women in court.
attributes.background: As government employees, members of the UK's Armed Forces who fought in Iraq, Afghanistan or elsehwere whilst serving the Crown, should not have to pay for their defence in court.
attributes.additional_details: If Mr Blair's defence is going to be borne by the taxpayer then so should our servicemen and women who have fought and served on the Crown and Governments behalf.

attributes.action: Remove all tolls from the River Mersey.
attributes.background: The River Mersey will end up with 2 bridges and x2 tunnels that will be tolled in the next 12 months. The cost of the build, upkeep and repair of these huge national infrastructures have been given to the people of Merseyside. Who pays for the upkeep of the bridges & tunnels of The River Thames.
attributes.additional_details:
The bridges & tunnels are part of the national infrastructure and should not be the responsibility of the people of Merseyside in the same way the bridge to Skye is not theirs to pay for, the Bridges of The Thames are not purely for the people of London.
there are many roads, bridges & tunnels that are paid for nationally including the upkeep, I feel the same should be done on Merseyside.

attributes.action: Make it law for MPs to see Constituents whether they support them or not
attributes.background: During the Waspi campaign M.P.s have refused to see their Constituents as they don't support the issue.Also, they did not hand in the paper petitions to the House of Commons 11/10/16 and other M.P.s had to do this for them
